RESOLVED_ENTITIES.marked United States Border Patrol sedan: the marked United States Border Patrol sedan
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the window of the marked United States B: the window of the marked United States Border Patrol sedan
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the front seat of the pickup truck campe: the front seat of the pickup truck camper
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the back seat of the pickup truck camper: the back seat of the pickup truck camper
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the rear window to the camper compartmen: the rear window of the pickup truck camper
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the floor of the pickup truck camper: the floor of the pickup truck camper
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the United States Court of Appeals for t: the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the camper compartment of pickup truck c: the camper compartment of the pickup truck camper
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the pickup truck camper: Vehicle suspected of carrying people, traveling northbound on Interstate Highway 35, with three females in the front seat and five or six men in the back seat, and fourteen additional males found hiding in the camper compartment. It was stopped more than 100 miles from the United States-Mexican border. The vehicle appeared heavily loaded and its windows were completely fogged over. Stopped by United States Border Patrol due to suspicious circumstances.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the marked United States Border Patrol s: Vehicle used by United States Border Patrol agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron for surveillance, from which Baron observed the occupants of the pickup truck camper
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the window of the marked United States B: Window through which Baron leaned out to observe the pickup truck camper
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the front seat of the pickup truck campe: Seat where three females were observed by Baron
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the back seat of the pickup truck camper: Seat where five or six men were observed by Baron, who attempted to conceal themselves when a flashlight was shined
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the rear window of the pickup truck camp: Window through which additional males were found hiding in the camper compartment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the floor of the pickup truck camper: Location where fourteen additional males were found hiding
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Court of Appeals for t: Court responsible for considering the appeal of Maria De Jesus Garcia and for prior decisions on the Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the camper compartment of the pickup tru: Compartment where additional males were found hiding
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: Case in which Maria De Jesus Garcia launches a two-pronged attack against the modified Allen charge given to the jury
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the modified Allen charge: Charge given to the jury, subject of Maria De Jesus Garcia's appeal, and considered potentially coercive when given on a Friday afternoon after the jury had indicated being deadlocked
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States District Court: Court that used the modified Allen charge in United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia and has discretion over its use
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pena-Cantu: Case in which the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit rejected a general attack on the Allen charge as being inherently coercive
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pacheco: Case that affirmed the decision in United States v. Pena-Cantu
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Orona-Sanchez: Case that upheld the use of the modified Allen charge
